law.catch_line: Promptly after appointment, the personal representative of a decedent's estate shall:...

text.section:
Promptly after appointment, the personal representative of a decedent's estate shall:
Make a reasonably diligent effort to ascertain the names and addresses of the decedent's creditors; and
Mail or otherwise deliver a notice to those creditors whose names and addresses he has ascertained of the time within which their claims may be presented under § 8-103(a) of this article.
Notice under this section shall be sufficient if the personal representative mails or otherwise delivers to a creditor a copy of the notice required by § 7-103(b) of this subtitle.

section.section: The failure of a creditor to receive notice under this section shall not extend the time within which the creditor may present his claim beyond 6 months from the date of the decedent's death.

The personal representative, individually and on behalf of the estate, shall not be liable for failing under this section to ascertain or notify a creditor or for giving notice to a person who is not a creditor of the decedent.
